com.siperian.sif.message.mrm

Class MultiMergeRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.siperian.sif.message.SiperianRequest
      • com.siperian.sif.message.SiperianObjectRequest
        • com.siperian.sif.message.mrm.MultiMergeRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataProvider, SiperianObjectUidProvider, Serializable

    public class MultiMergeRequest
extends SiperianObjectRequest
implements SiperianObjectUidProvider, DataProvider
    Merges multiple base object records that have been identified as representing the same object and allows specifying the field level overrides for the merged record. MultiMerge API is a more generic form of the Merge API and should be used for merging groups of records. Merge API should be used for pair-wise merges.

    For example, there may be multiple base object records with the same account number "1234567" and account type "Personal". Each base object record has its own set of cross reference records. When these records are merged with the call to the MultiMerge API the result is a single base object record with that has the cross references from all the merged base object records. The consolidated value for each field in the merged record is either determined through the survivorship rules based on the cross references of the records that are being merged or they are specified through the override values in the API. The combined record receives the rowid of the first object in the list specified through the setRecordKeyList(ArrayList) method.

    Required Parameters:

    • RecordKeyList - List of keys for records to be merged.
    • Record - Sets the override values and specify the base object or package for the API to operate on. The override values are optional. The Record.setSiperianObjectUid(String) is required.

    Optional Parameters:

    • taskId - If specified and the match table record associated with the merge being performed is contains the specified value, the task will be marked as CLOSED. Otherwise, any task associated with the records being merged will be marked OBSOLETE.

    Usage Example:

    The following example merges 3 record with ROWID_OBJECTs 1,2,and 3 into a record with ROWID_OBJECT = 1 using the package P_PARTY and provides the override value for the NAME field of the merged record.

    MultiMergeRequest request = new MultiMergeRequest ();

    ArrayList recordKeys = new ArrayList ();
    RecordKey key = new RecordKey ();
    recordKeys.add(RecordKey.rowid("1"));
    recordKeys.add(RecordKey.rowid("2"));
    recordKeys.add(RecordKey.rowid("3"));

    Record record = new Record();
    record.setSiperianObjectUid(SiperianObjectType.PACKAGE.makeUid(P_PARTY));
    record.setField(new Field("NAME", "John"));
    request.setRecordKeyList (recordKeys);
    request.setRecord (record);
    MultiMergeResponse response = sipClient.process(multiMergeRequest);

    See Also:
    MergeRequest, MergeResponse, Serialized Form

    API Pair: MultiMergeResponse

    API Group: Data

      • getMatchRuleUid

        public String getMatchRuleUid()
        See corresponding setter method for details.

        Returns:
        String containing the Uid of the match rule used in the request.

      • setMatchRuleUid

        public void setMatchRuleUid(String matchRuleUid)
        Match rule that the merged records will be attributed to.

        The match rule UID needs to be specified in the following format:

        MATCH_RULE.<TABLE_NAME>|<MATCH RULESET NAME>|<MATCH RULE NUMBER>

        Parameters:
        matchRuleUid - Unique identifier for the match rule.

      • getRecord

      • getRecordKeyList

        public ArrayList getRecordKeyList()
        See corresponding setter method for details.

        Returns:
        List of RecordKey of the data object that user wants to merge.

      • setRecordKeyList

        public void setRecordKeyList(ArrayList recordKeyList)
        Specifies the list of objects that will be merged by this API in a single group. The merged object will be assigned the first ROWID_OBJECT specified in the list.

        Parameters:
        recordKeyList - List of RecordKey of the data object that user wants to merge.

      • setTaskId

        public void setTaskId(String taskId)
        Set the key of the task in context when the merge operation is performed. If specified and the match table record associated with the merge being performed is contains the specified value, the task will be marked as CLOSED. Otherwise, any task associated with the records being merged will be marked OBSOLETE.

        public TransactionAttributeType getTransactionAttributeType()

        Overrides:
        getTransactionAttributeType in class SiperianRequest
